frameDefinitions: A Cognizer calls up an episodic memory of past Experience or an Impression of a Salient_entity formed  on the basis of past experience.
A Representative is authorized by a Represented to communicate on behalf of the Represented.

An Initial_element is converted into a Final_element via a process of decay, fusion, or fission which changes the number or type of hadrons (protons or neutrons) in the nucleus of the atoms that make up the Element.  '5.5 percent of nucleii decay from tritium to He3 in a year .'
A Speaker addresses an Audience on a particular Topic.
The words in this frame describe Manners of verbal communication.
Artists work at various tasks that further the completion of a film, play, television show, or other similar Production.
frameExamples: Kozmo could <t>remember</t> when his modem was the fastest he could buy.
5.5 percent of nucleii <t>decay</t> from tritium to He3 in a year .
McNamara <t>addressed</t> congress on the state of affairs of the Department of Defense.
Steven Spielberg <t>directed</t> several films for Universal Pictures.
listRoleDefinitions: A person who recalls memories of past experience or impressions.
A person or thing that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers as being involved in some state or event or as having some property.
A past event or state that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> witnessed and is now recalling. The <fen>Experience</fen> may be a specific event or state or a vaguer period that is treated as a unit.

A property that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> attributes to the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> based on their past experience of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> or a category to which the <fen>Salient_entity</fen> is assigned.
A property or role that a <fen>Salient_entity</fen> actually held and which frames the memories that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has of the <fen>Salient_entity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> remembers the experience.
The <fen>Representative</fen> speaks for another.
A substance definable in terms of the kind(s) of atoms that make it up.
The type of <fen>Element</fen> that results from the process.
The type of <fen>Element</fen> that begins the process.
The time at which the <fen>Element</fen> undergoes the transformation.
The location where the nuclear process occurs.
The person or persons to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> delivers their text.
The person who orally delivers a text about a <fen>Topic</fen> to a passive <fen>Audience</fen>.
What the text that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces is about.
The <fen>Time</fen> describes when the speaking occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location where the speaking occurs.
Speaker is the sentient entity that produces a Message or communicates about a Topic. It is expressed as the External Argument of verbs:
Addressee is the person to whom the Speaker  is communicating.  When expressed, the Addressee occurs as a PP Complement:
Message is the content which is communicated by the Speaker. The Message may be a direct quote, a finite complement clause or an NP Object:

Topic is the subject matter of the communicated Message.  It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by <ment>about</ment> and, in this frame, is frequently preceded by a quantificational noun which is treated as referring to the Message:
The time at which the communication event takes place.
The location at which the communication event takes place.
The <fen>Artist</fen> works off-stage to help make the <fen>Production</fen>.
The <fen>Production</fen> is the final product put out by the off-stage (and on-stage) participants.
An <fen>Artist</fen> may be categorizedy by <fen>Type</fen>.
Often (especially with film or television) the <fen>Production</fen> is advertised and transmitted to the audience by the <fen>Distributor</fen>.
This role indicates the particular orgainzaion that makes the <fen>Production</fen>.
This role indicates the <fen>Medium</fen> in which a particular <fen>Artist</fen> works or a <fen>Production</fen> is made.
In screen performances, the <fen>Performer</fen> is filmed as he or she acts out a role with respect to the larger <fen>Production</fen>
The music which may be performed in the performance of the <fen>Production</fen>, either in isolation or accompanying actions and speech.
A <fen>Scene</fen> is a sub-part of a larger production.  In film, scenes are sometimes recorded independently, and later edited into the final movie.
This role indicates the time when the <fen>Production</fen> is made.
This role indicates the location of production.
listRoleExamples: I will truly miss Delmar and <fex>I</fex> will always remember when his eyes lit up everytime he got ice-cream.
today I saw a sister's exclassmate, and didn't recognise him, I remember <fex>him</fex> taller.
I can still remember <fex>saying the pledge every morning before class in elementary school</fex>, a rare occurrence among elementary school kids nowadays.
I remember Peter <fex>as immensely kind in those first three weeks before I was packed off to boarding school</fex>.
Atulprasad is principally remembered <fex>as a musician and composer</fex>.
I 'll <fex>never</fex> forget being in hospital
He lectured <fex>to the officers of the Scots Guard</fex>  in  1929.
<fex>You</fex> have to sermonize about the good times
He was the Director: he could lecture <fex>on whomever he liked</fex>.
<fex>The boy</fex> mumbled an apology.
The taxi driver chattered away <fex>to me</fex> about gardening.
<fex>'I- It was an accident,'</fex> Jo stammered.
The actor chattered <fex>about the difficulties of being famous</fex>.
<fex>John Williams</fex> composed the soundtrack to Star Wars.
Ralph Smith produced <fex>the off-Broadway hit 'Why Is My Name Ralph?'</fex>.
<fex>Hollywood</fex> director
Even desperate producers would never produce a film <fex>for that television station</fex>.
The latest performance produced <fex>by The Umbrella Thesbians</fex> was a major hit in France.
He produces <fex>for television</fex>
This particular scene was shot <fex>with a local choir and dancers</fex>.
Silence of the Lambs was filmed <fex>in 1991</fex>.
The documentary was shot <fex>on location</fex>.
